description: At the entrance to a Buddhist temple or sacred hall, attire should be modest and shoes removed before entering.
expected_actions: remove shoes before entering the sacred hall
cover shoulders and knees (use a shawl or long skirt/sarong)
borrow or use the provided cover-up if underdressed

acceptable_variants.pattern: Borrow a shawl or sarong from the booth to cover shoulders and legs.
Wrap a long skirt/sarong around your waist to cover the knees.
Change into long pants or a long skirt; put on a light jacket to cover shoulders.
Remove footwear at the threshold or shoe rack before stepping inside.
If only viewing outdoor areas, remain respectful and check signage about shoes.

red_flags: enter the temple hall with shoes on
proceed in sleeveless top and short shorts without covering up
argue about the dress code or mock the rule
visual_cues: roof or architecture typical of a temple
exceptions: some outdoor compounds allow shoes; the inner hall typically requires removal
medical footwear accommodations may apply; socks are usually acceptable
notes: Treat 'cover with a jacket' as modesty compliance if shoulders/knees become covered.

norm_title: Offering to a monk (avoid direct touch)
description: When offering items to a monk, avoid direct physical contact; use two hands and/or place items on a tray or cloth.
expected_actions: offer with two hands while keeping respectful distance
place the item on an offering tray/cloth or nearby surface for the monk to pick up
avoid direct physical contact with the monk

acceptable_variants.pattern: Place the item on the tray in front of the monk, then step back slightly.
Hold the item with two hands and present it without touching the monk.
Ask a lay attendant to pass the item via a tray or cloth.
Set the item down respectfully so the monk can take it himself.

red_flags: hand the item directly into the monk’s hands with touch
touch the monk’s robe or body
intrude into personal space or act casually
exceptions: If the monk declines or redirects, follow his instruction respectfully.
notes: Lower posture or gentle demeanor can be respectful but is not strictly required by the rubric.

description: Do not touch the head of students, adults, or elders; use respectful alternatives to show affection or praise.
expected_actions: avoid touching the head
use verbal praise or a friendly smile instead
if physical gesture is needed, prefer a light touch on shoulder/upper arm (only when appropriate)

acceptable_variants.pattern: Offer a warm verbal compliment or encouragement.
Smile, nod, or give a thumbs-up instead of touching the head.
If context allows, lightly touch the shoulder/upper arm rather than the head.

red_flags: pat or ruffle someone’s hair
press or push the head downward
treat head-touching as casual affection in formal settings
exceptions: Close family with small children may vary; in school/formal contexts avoid head-touching.
notes: If unsure, avoid physical contact and use verbal praise.

description: When greeting an elder or teacher, perform a polite wai rather than initiating a handshake.
expected_actions: perform a wai greeting (palms together, slight bow)
speak a polite greeting while wai-ing

acceptable_variants.pattern: Bring palms together at chest level and bow your head slightly.
Offer a wai with a polite verbal greeting.
If the elder initiates a handshake, respond gently and add a small nod.

red_flags: insist on a handshake or casual high-five when a wai is expected
ignore the elder or pass by without greeting
exceptions: in some business or international contexts, a handshake may be acceptable if initiated by the elder
notes: Tone, posture, and eye contact should remain respectful.

norm_title: Stand still for the national anthem
description: In public spaces when the national anthem plays, stop moving and stand respectfully until it finishes.
expected_actions: stop walking and stand still respectfully
remain quiet until the anthem ends
face the flag or the sound source if visible

acceptable_variants.pattern: Pause your activity and stand quietly until the anthem finishes.
Remove hats/caps and face the flag, if present.
Stand in place and avoid talking or using the phone.

red_flags: continue walking noisily or behaving disruptively
mock, dance, or display disrespect during the anthem
exceptions: Emergencies or safety reasons may require movement.
notes: Silence and stillness are key signals of respect.

description: At a communal meal, take food from shared dishes using the serving spoon, not personal utensils.
expected_actions: use the shared serving spoon for communal dishes
place food onto your plate before eating
ask for a serving spoon if it is missing

acceptable_variants.pattern: Serve yourself from the shared dish with the serving spoon provided.
If there is no serving spoon, request one before taking food.
Avoid using personal spoon/chopsticks directly in the shared dish.

red_flags: use personal utensils to take from the shared dish
double-dip or place used utensils back into communal food
exceptions: Individual plated service does not require a serving spoon.
notes: Waiting your turn and passing dishes politely also reflects good manners.

description: In family-oriented public spaces, avoid overt public displays of affection; keep gestures modest.
expected_actions: avoid overt kissing or intimate displays in public
choose discreet, modest gestures if needed

acceptable_variants.pattern: Hold hands or stand close; save kissing for private settings.
Opt for a brief side hug instead of a prolonged embrace.
Be mindful of families and elders nearby; keep it discreet.

red_flags: prolonged kissing or overt intimacy in public
straddling or explicit displays in shared spaces
exceptions: Certain events/venues may be more permissive; read the room.
notes: Conservative norms may vary by place and time of day.

norm_title: Stand and greet when teacher enters
description: When a teacher enters the classroom, students should stand and greet respectfully, often with a wai.
expected_actions: stand to greet the teacher upon entry
offer a polite greeting (often with a wai)
sit when signaled or permitted

acceptable_variants.pattern: Rise as the teacher arrives and greet respectfully.
Give a brief wai with a polite greeting before sitting.
Remain attentive and quiet during the opening exchange.

red_flags: remain seated and inattentive during the teacher’s entry
interrupt or use a disrespectful tone
visual_cues: teacher in official uniform or professional attire
classroom setting with students at desks
exceptions: Accessibility needs may prevent standing; greet verbally with respect.
notes: Uniforms can be a strong cue of teacher authority in some schools.

description: On trains or the BTS/MRT, keep phone use quiet; avoid loud calls and external audio.
expected_actions: lower your voice or avoid calls
switch phone to silent/vibrate
avoid playing audio aloud; use headphones if needed

acceptable_variants.pattern: Send a message instead of making a call.
Speak briefly and softly if a call is unavoidable.
Use silent/vibrate mode to avoid disturbing others.

red_flags: speak loudly on the phone
use speakerphone or play music aloud in the carriage
exceptions: Urgent calls may be brief and quiet; step off at next stop if needed.
notes: Avoid blocking doors or aisles while on calls.

norm_title: Offer your seat to a monk on the bus
description: On public buses, offer your seat to a monk as a sign of respect and comfort.
expected_actions: stand and offer your seat to the monk
if unable to stand, politely ask others to offer their seat

acceptable_variants.pattern: Stand up and gesture to the seat for the monk to sit.
Politely ask a nearby seated passenger to offer their seat.
Move to create space near a priority seat if available.

red_flags: ignore the standing monk
ask the monk to move away from you
exceptions: If the monk declines, ensure safe space and avoid physical contact.
notes: Offering the seat promptly is viewed positively.

norm_title: Offer your seat to an elderly passenger
description: On public transport, offer your seat to elderly passengers for comfort and safety.
expected_actions: stand and offer your seat to the elderly person
assist them to steady if appropriate

acceptable_variants.pattern: Rise and gesture that your seat is available to them.
Help them balance while they move toward the seat, if appropriate.
If you cannot stand, signal to others to offer their seat.

red_flags: remain seated while the elderly person stands nearby
rush past or jostle the elderly to take a seat
exceptions: If you have a condition that prevents standing, communicate politely and seek help from others.
notes: Eye contact and a polite gesture can make the offer clear.

norm_title: Slight bow when passing an elder
description: When passing close to an elder in a corridor or narrow space, dip your head/shoulder slightly and excuse yourself politely.
expected_actions: lower your head slightly or angle your shoulders while passing
softly say 'excuse me' or a polite phrase as you pass

acceptable_variants.pattern: Make a small bow of the head/shoulders when walking past.
Turn your body slightly to give space and pass gently.
Offer a quiet 'excuse me' with a respectful tone.

red_flags: push past without acknowledgment
brush shoulders deliberately or block the way
exceptions: In crowded or emergency situations, prioritize safety and apologize briefly.
notes: A slight bow is sufficient; no need for exaggerated movements.
